alert.note: Alert for Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sumner County through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Wellington. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wellington and Perth. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 7 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
